thread.title: Jamie Carragher hits out at Dele Alli over Tottenham midfielder's "appalling" challenge against Gent
thread.title_full: Jamie Carragher hits out at Dele Alli over Tottenham midfielder's "appalling" challenge against Gent

author: Liam Corless
title: Jamie Carragher hits out at Dele Alli over Tottenham midfielder's "appalling" challenge against Gent
text:
Sport Jamie Carragher hits out at Dele Alli over Tottenham midfielder's "appalling" challenge against Gent Alli saw red for a disgraceful knee-high lunge as Spurs crashed out of the Europa League on Thursday Share Dele Alli earned himself a straight red card for this challenge on Thursday night (Photo: Offside Sports Photography)   
Jamie Carragher has criticised Dele Alli for the midfielder's horrendous challenge in Tottenham's clash with Gent on Thursday night. 
Alli was shown a straight red card for his knee-high lunge on Brecht Dejaegere as Spurs crashed out of the Europa League at Wembley. 
Carragher branded the foul "appalling" and called for 20-year-old Alli to shelve his mean streak if he is to realise his lofty potential. 
"Alliâ€™s foul on Gent midfielder Brecht Dejaegere was appalling and could have easily broken his right leg," Carragher wrote in his Daily Mail column. 
"It is sometimes said that Alli would not be the same if he loses the aggression from his game but that, frankly, is nonsense. He can still be a gifted, goalscoring midfielder without trying to chop an opponent in half. Jamie Carragher has criticised Alli (Photo: AFP) Alli saw red for a shocking lunge on Gent's Brecht Dejaegere (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Spurs crashed out of the Europa League on Thursday night (Photo: PA) 
"If Alli had stayed on the pitch at Wembley, Tottenham win that game and reach the last 16. He let down himself, his manager and his team when they needed him." 
Gent's Dejaegere revealed Alli apologised for the foul after the match. 
"Dele Alli just said sorry to me and that's nice from him, he's a professional," Dejaegere said. 
"We're okay, it's football. I saw the images and it could have been much worse. I don't think he meant it because he came to apologise himself." Like us on Facebook
